only to answer a few of his questions, just from what i learned,
Serizawa K=
amo was assasinated by Hijikata, Okita, Yamanami, Harada
(and another one t=
hat I forget or my memory is getting bad), basically
for Kondo to take cont=
rol over the group.  They were fighting over the
groups name and this was o=
ne of the reasons.  Group politics play a
huge role on the front but in sec=
ret it was to get Kondo as the
group's leader.  But Hijikata made rules tha=
t you can find at this
site that explains a bunch:  http://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/Shinsengumi 

the rule that was broken was: not to deviate from the b=
ushido code and
Kamo was doing a bunch.  That was the front that was put up=
 but that
was not the real motive.  That and to get rid of the ronin that c=
ome
with Kamo.

The reason for the Shinsengumi was to pretty much keep the =
peace in
Kyoto.  That and the answered directly to the Aizu and Tokugawa. 
=
Choshu , Satsuma and Tosa clans were the enemies.  

Ikedaya incident:  Shi=
nsengumi were tipped off by their spy that the
Choshu were going to meet th=
ere.  Kondo let the group with Okita that
reached the inn first.  Huge batt=
le.  Also, the first time Okita
coughed up blood.  Many Choshu men were kil=
led.

What would cause a ronin to join the Shinsengumi rather than
anyof th=
e other factions? What type of person would join the
Shinsengumi?   My gues=
s and opinion, Shinsengumi were noble and fought
for truth.  That would be =
a great cause.

> Roshigumi and going to Kyoto? I think from rumors that the Choshu
were a=
massing there in secret and Kastura Koguru.
